title: Watch the first all-women spacewalk on Friday
text:
The first all-women spacewalk is scheduled for Friday, October 18, 2019. Two women astronauts from NASA will create history by conducting the spacewalk. Astronauts Christina Koch and Jessica Meir, who are also on the International Space Station (ISS) will step outside the station to replace a failed power controller. Although Koch has been part of three spacewalks before this, it is a first for Meir.





NASA will be covering the spacewalk live, from 10.30 am UTC (4 pm IST) onwards. The walk is slated to start at 11.50 am UTC (5.20 pm IST).

.@NASA targets all-female spacewalk for no earlier than Friday to replace a failed power controller. The Exp 61 crew adjusts its schedule to accommodate the new spacewalk plans. Read more... https://t.co/NacxbVx9U7 pic.twitter.com/0CiTn45dB0 — Intl. Space Station (@Space_Station) October 16, 2019

The spacewalk, was scheduled for October 21, but was brought forward to Friday. Originally, the first all-female spacewalk was slated for March 2019, but had to be postponed since they did not have enough medium-sized space suits on the ISS to fit both women.





NASA also sent out s statement informing that the failure of the power controller has not impacted the operations of the space station, the crew safety or the experiments being conducted.
description: The all-women spacewalk was scheduled for October 21, but has been pushed forward to Friday to replace a failed power controller
